text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the answer to caution the user about checking the platform's Terms and Conditions (T&Cs) for any inadvertent waiver or license granted by the user. The candidate answer explicitly addresses this in Section 1, stating: \"Posting online does not waive your rights. Publication on the internet does not place work into the public domain or create an implied licence for commercial AI training.\" While it doesn't explicitly say 'check your T&Cs,' it directly addresses the core legal concept underpinning that caution—that uploading content might imply a license or waiver—and dismisses it based on UK law principles, which serves the intent of the criterion by advising the user on the implications of their online posting.", "criterion_id": "76fd6711-b3da-40f5-93ef-8652b6002774"}
